post.title: I'm going to give my old books to the homeless, any ideas for refining this plan?
post.body:
In an effort to lighten my load, I plan to give a load of books to the homeless I see out on the streets around town. I don't care what they do with the books, they can read them, sell them or throw them away, but I'm hoping they read, then sell.

Does anyone here have any ideas for refining this plan, anything to input regarding what I should do or change?

I got my inspiration for this idea from the [Pavement Bookwork (CSMONITOR, clearnet link)](https://www.csmonitor.com/Books/2014/0625/Video-of-homeless-South-African-the-Pavement-Bookworm-goes-viral)

post.title: What are some of your favourite websites?
post.body: Leave SFW websites in the comments. What are some websites you know of? I've recently been listening to music on Jamendo.com quite a lot so that's my entry.

post.title: Zeronet in China and DPRK update
post.body:
Wow, parts of China are inundated with blue in this image and the number of nodes in DPRK seems to have gone up.

![Screenshot_from_2017-06-13_02-31-49.png (387x451)](data/img/post_21_Screenshot_from_2017-06-13_02-31-49.png)

post.title: Ecotricity the UK's green energy provider has now got its own mobile service called Ecotalk
post.body:
You can find out more about the newish MVNO here: [www.ecotalk.co.uk](http://www.ecotalk.co.uk)

> _"Mobile phones are an increasingly important part of our lives – and they have a big environmental impact that’s not really talked about. They don't use much power themselves, but the networks they rely upon really do._
> 
> _We power all of your calls, texts and data with green energy from the wind and the sun. We do that by allocating green energy to cover the network use of all our customers._
> 
> _We use something known as Renewable Energy Guarantees of Origin (REGOs) to verify where our energy comes from and how we allocate it – it’s an international system for identifying the source of green energy._
> 
> _In the meantime, there’s not really a lot of information out there about the true extent of the mobile phone industry on our environment – so our mission is to find out more and publish it here."_

![Screenshot_from_2017-06-12_17-02-59.png (614x887)](data/img/post_20_Screenshot_from_2017-06-12_17-02-59.png)

post.title: Montenegro joined the evil empire
post.body:
June 5th, tiny Montenegro joined the evil empire.

> Allied Foreign Ministers signed Montenegro's Accession Protocol in May 2016, after which all 28 national parliaments voted to ratify Montenegro's membership. A flag-raising ceremony for Montenegro will take place at NATO Headquarters on 7 June 2017.
> 
> Today marks NATO's first enlargement since 1 April 2009, when Albania and Croatia joined the Alliance.

An updated map of NATO territory with Montenegro included:

![Screenshot_from_2017-06-05_21-25-07.jpg (1200x797)](data/img/post_18_Screenshot_from_2017-06-05_21-25-07.jpg)

![](data:,)

post.title: Zite takedown
post.body: A few years ago you'd always hear about the anonymity of Tor and by extension how difficult it would be to take down onion sites, alas, in the years since many websites have been taken down, especially drug markets. I think it'd be very interesting to see a concerted effort by an agency like the FBI attempt to take down a zite, and see once and for all whether they could actually succeed.

post.title: Social democracy leads to fascism
post.body:
"Under the circumstances of the present crisis the social democrats energetically develop the traitorous theory that the crisis hampers the revolutionary struggle of the proletariat and predestines it to failure. Trotsky joins his voice to this chorus of social democrats. The "Left" social democrats have invented a special theory that the circumstances of the crisis create not a revolutionary but a counter-revolutionary situation. Therefore, they say, the working class can only conduct a defensive but not an offensive struggle!
It is easy to grasp the full, traitorous import of such counter revolutionary inventions. The crises sharpens all the contradictions of capitalism to the utmost. It is in just such circumstances that the social democrats come out as 'healers' at the bedside of sick capitalism. They proclaim their task to be, not to help in burying capitalism, but to help in 'curing' it. Paralysing the revolutionary energy of the workers they thus open wide the door for the victory of fascism, as was clearly demonstrated in Germany."
